title: Peter Andrew Jestyn Phillips
summary:
Peter Andrew Jestyn Phillips (born May 1, 1962) is Chief Executive of Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a non-teaching department of the University of Cambridge, when it was formed on 1 August 2021.
He is also a Fellow of Wolfson College, Cambridge, a Trustee of the Cambridge Commonwealth Trust and a Council Member and former President of The Publishers Association.He was previously a trustee of the Nuffield Trust, the Crafts Council, Article 19 and the John Schofield Trust, an adviser to the Royal College of Physicians, Chairman of the Sabre Trust and a director of Parliamentary Broadcasting Limited.
The Bookseller described Phillips as one of the "most influential people in UK publishing”. [1]
